intro: Tarenaya houstonii, commonly known as Houston's tarenaya, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils along streambanks and in wetlands. Tarenaya houstonii is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun to partial shade.
